intro: Euryloma squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrose euryloma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly appearance. The plant features small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Its leaves are usually covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy texture. Euryloma squarrosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
